sub_title: D&E Mechatronics Engineer @ASML | Double Masters @TU Delft- Aerospace Engineering & Annotation Entrepreneurship| Nova Talent
summary:
An engineer with business acumen, entrepreneurial mindset, leadership capabilities, and communication and networking skills who love to solve real-life problems with direct impact on society,  may it be engineering, business or marketing. 

I am currently working on the control system which ensure NANO METER accuracy  on our state-of-the-art EUV lithography machine for semiconductor manufacturing, at ASML as a D&E Mechatronics Engineer. 
 
Along with being an Engineering Enthusiast, I love to read about Business and Marketing as they help me understand how the world works and give me a much more pragmatic perspective of the world we live in.


Let's Connect!!

treasury_media.title: Aerospace engineering - Naman Sachdeva
treasury_media.description: Naman Sachdeva is a masters student pursuing Aerospace Engineering at the Faculty of Aerospace Engineering, TU Delft, Netherlands and is passionate about anything that fly. Along with his passion for engineering and solving problems, his interests include Leadership, Management, Business Strategy and Economics.

projects.title: Techno-Economic Feasibility Analysis of Solid-Oxide Fuel Cell- Gas Turbine Hybrid Propulsion System fuelled by Hydrogen, Co-guidance with Embraer (Master Thesis)
projects.description:
Advisors- 
1)Dr. Victor Scholten, Director, Delft Centre for Entrepreneurship, TU Delft.
2) Dr. Carlo De Servi, Senior Researcher, Faculty of Aerospace Engineering, TU Delft.
3) Mr. Carlos Mourao, Senior Principal Engineer for Hydrogen and Fuel Cell, Embraer

-The aim of the study is to analyse the technical and economic feasibility of SOFC integrated turbofan for a commercial aircraft.
 
- Developing a zero-dimensional fuel cell model in Python and integrating it with PyCycle (OPENMDAO) to build a closed SOFC-GT hybrid propulsion system.

- Developing a comparison methodology to fairly compare the SOFC-GT hybrid with the reference turbofan engine.

- Developed an economic analysis methodology to analyze the required specific power of fuel cell system to break-even on investment.

• No major studies has been done in the past on this concept. Hence, the result of the thesis will provide the insights on the challenges and advantages of this new concept

projects.title: Business and Financial Modelling of SOFC-GT hybrid energy convertor unit
projects.description:
The team worked on building a Business and Financial model for a revolutionary fuel to energy(electricity) converter device which can 
1) Reduce the carbon emissions by 35.3 % for hydrocarbon fuels
2) Reduce Lifetime operating cost to the customer by 26.3%
3) Work on multiple fuels like diesel ,kerosene and Natural Gas along with the fuel for future which is hydrogen and biomass. (Fuel Flexibility)
4) Enable the Hydrogen Economy as the well to wheel efficiency has improves significantly.
5) Has applications in Remote areas, microgrid and residential buildings.

projects.title: PU(Pressure Ulcers) Prevent
projects.description:
The Project was the part of Virtual Health E-lab whose focus was to help the Medical Industry by solving their problems, especially during COVID-19 Pandemic. The project was under the Delft Center of Entrepreneurship.

I was the part of the team which worked on finding the solution of Pressure Ulcers, a common disease which is the result of staying in ICU for longer period, which could be deadly especially in COVID-19 Pandemic.

We built an integrated alarm system which will help nurses in prioritizing the patients which needed care in order to prevent the Pressure Ulcers based on an Artificial Intelligence  software. We built the product, Business model and presented it to the jury for recommending it to different hospitals.

We worked with many doctors along the journey and tried to understand the root cause of the problem and came up with the solution which is feasible.

projects.title: Variable Swept(Stroke) Volume Reciprocating Pump (Funded by the University)
projects.description:
A reciprocating pump has been designed and developed which can pump variable volume output per stroke while also changing the stroke rate. This pump has many applications in the field of medical especially designing the substitute for a human or an animal heart. The heart pumps variable blood output per stroke in differet conditions and also capable of changing the stroke rate (Heart beat/ min). This pump emulates the heart and provide better alternatives than those currently available in the market

• Led and managed the whole project along with managing the finance and budget.
• Designed and developed a new mechanism to pump variable stroke volume and rate at a same time.
• Successfully developed and tested the prototype .

projects.description:
•	Aim was to determine the change in lift and drag coefficient by using tubercles at the leading edge of high lift Airfoil.
•	Designed models of Airfoils with tubercles in SolidWorks and simulated the models in ANSYS.
•	Simulation was done at different angle of inclinations and compared the results with normal Airfoil.
•	Scored highest marks in the class of 60 students.

authors.headline: D&E Mechatronics Engineer @ASML | Double Masters @TU Delft- Aerospace Engineering & Annotation Entrepreneurship| Nova Talent

profile_positions.description:
ASML is a Dutch semiconductor company which builds the advance lithography machines on which the semiconductor chips like processors and memory storage devices are made. ASML machines are used by Samsung, Apple, Intel, TSMC and many more companies around the world, which makes "ASML a company changing the world at 1 nm (nanometer) at a time".

I am currently working as the Mechatronics engineer in the D&E department on the most advanced lithography platform in the world. My job responsibility include working on the control systems which can have nano meter accuracy.
profile_positions.title: Mechatronics Engineer

profile_positions.description: Nova is the global by-invitation-only top-talent network that connects high potential individuals amongst themselves and with the best professional opportunities. Nova has the global community of the top ~3% high potential individuals from different domains and more than 90% of these individuals are professionals.
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
University Ambassador for Delft University of Technology. My job is to find the top and global talents around the university and nominate them for the Nova Talent Membership.  

Nova is the global by-invitation-only top-talent network that connects high potential individuals amongst themselves and with the best professional opportunities. Nova has the global community of the top ~3% high potential individuals from different domains and more than 90% of these individuals are professionals.
profile_positions.title: University Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
I am working as a Freelance Marketing Consultant at Delft Centre for Entrepreneurship (DCE) where I am working on 2 projects:

1) Building a state-of-the-art new course related to "entrepreneurship skills" for the students of TU Delft. It is very important to learn the skills of entrepreneurship as all great companies are highly entrepreneurial in nature and they look for these in their employees as well.

2) Building a strong Marketing Campaign to aware the students of TU Delft about Entrepreneurial ecosystem in TU Delft.

3) Building relationships with different Faculties winning TU Delft on behalf of DCE for a long term collaboration.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Marketing Graduate Teaching Assistant at Delft Centre for Entrepreneurship(DCE), my job is to market DCE in and outside the TU Delft.

Entrepreneurship is not only about building businesses but solving real-life problems, may it be the corporate or real world, and get things done. My job is to spread awareness about the real meaning of Entrepreneurship or being Entrepreneurial.

How I achieve that:-
1) By Organizing DCE flagship Event- Delft Startup Night (DSN), a university-wide event where startups from all over the Netherlands come and share their learnings with the students. I have moderated 2 panel on Blockchain and Metaverse in one DSN and hosted 2 DSNs.
 
2) By organizing introduction events to spread awareness about DCE courses and events.

3) By establishing better communication and relationship between DCE and Other Faculties in TU Delft as well as with organizations outside TU Delft.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant- Marketing Team

profile_positions.description:
Spacefluencers is an initiative which provides a platform to people from space industry and different sectors to connect with each other and spread awareness in younger generation to understand more about the Space Industry.

For more information, please visit the website:- https://spacefluencers.com/
profile_positions.title: Lead Networker & Podcaster

profile_positions.description:
Democratically elected Representative to Faculty Student Council of the Faculty of Aerospace Engineering, TU Delft.

Wallet Includes:- Master Education Program and Online Education.

Responsibilities:- 
1) Responsible for all the issues related to the master education program.
2) Follow-up with the pilot for admission to the master program
3) Any complaints that the Master students have with respect to exams, grading, etc.
4) Preparing and conducting surveys for obtaining the opinion of master students in matters
such as facilities, Brightspace, Collegerama, food quality and process, etc.
5) Identifying the targets for the year and accordingly contributing to the policy document

The Faculty Student Council, or FSC, is an elected body of Aerospace Engineering students to the faculty administration. FSC is a legal student body that is involved in decision making in the faculty  and ensure the quality of the education and services within the faculty.
profile_positions.title: Commissioner of Master Education

profile_positions.description:
VSV ' Leonardo da Vinci' is the Society of Aerospace students at TU Delft, Netherlands. 

And Leonardo Times is the journal of VSV 'Leonardo da Vinci'. The hard copy of the magazine is circulated 4 times a year with a circulation of 5500 copies. 

We write about the recent technological developments in the aerospace industry and publish interviews with some of the biggest celebrities of the Aerospace Industry.

I work as a freelance writer, editor and interviewer at Leonardo Times.
profile_positions.title: Editor, Writer & Interviewer

Led the team which worked on building a Business and Financial model for a revolutionary fuel to energy(electricity) converter device which can 
1) Reduce the carbon emissions by 35.3 % for hydrocarbon fuels
2) Reduce Lifetime operating cost to the customer by 26.3%
3) Work on multiple fuels like diesel ,kerosene and Natural Gas along with the fuel for future which is hydrogen and biomass. (Fuel Flexibility)

profile_positions.title: Semifinalist Dutch Cleantech Challenge 2021

company.name: JIP - Joint Interdisciplinary Project in collaboration with Embraer

profile_positions.description:
Roles:- Project Lead & Head of Economics and Business.

Project Outcome:-

1) Inhouse developed innovative Fuel cell integrated propulsion system which increased the cruise efficiency from 34% to staggering 48 %, a relative change of 50%!!

2) Designed Tanks with boil off rate less than 0.1%/hr for liquid hydrogen.

3) 100% CO2 reduction, >80 % NOx reduction, > 40% contrail reduction, No soot and No SOx

4) Saving of € 304/ hr of flight in terms of sustainability costs (in 2030) which accounts for €15 million over the lifetime of the aircraft.(15 years)

5) Calculated the cost of retrofitting the aircraft to Embraer from year 2031 to 2040 , inflation and discount rate adjusted.

6) Built a Business case for Embraer and developed a strategy on how to move with project in future.

Key Responsibilities:-
1) Leading & Managing of the whole team and getting the best out of everyone.
2) Worked in every department , propulsion, integration , storage economics and business and maintained a collaborative environment.
3) Developed multiple concepts for propulsion and integration and critically analyzed them to find the most feasible solution along with the help of whole team.
4) Head of Economics and Business department and  responsible for the  economic feasibility analysis  and Business case.


Worked on building a road map for Hydrogen Aircraft in Collaboration with TU Delft, Embraer and AeroDelft . The project is to analyze the feasibility of a Hydrogen Powered Aircraft (Embraer E-145) and come up with a best possible design for a future fleet of hydrogen aircraft.  The Project will quantitatively and qualitatively analyze different propulsion systems like hydrogen combustion, fuel cell systems, batteries or a hybrid system and integrate them with the E-145 aircraft to come up with the great design in terms of Flight Performance and Economical Feasibility. Also developed the Business case for Embraer and built a strategy for how to further build the project.
profile_positions.title: Retrofitting an Embraer E-145 aircraft with Hydrogen. (Project Lead)

volunteer_experiences.description:
